title: Bi-Weekly Music Discussion Thread
selftext:
What is r/India listening to? Share and discuss songs, playlists, artists, or anything music-related here!

If you're a musician yourself, please share your work so we can all hear what up-and-coming musicians are doing these days.

Don't just mention stuff, link it! Links that are official and provided by the artists themselves are preferred.

**Music Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Music+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/06d0xwq1x8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=4195dbb767ebd70a3209ea46a4497062e788c176
comments:
Hame to loot Liya milke husan walooo nee...

[hame to loot liya](https://open.spotify.com/track/04uLrATjJntXhoRuPaXN5E?si=nL6QNQvUQJOe4DnpAvnG3Q)

Apart from that, I am learning this song lyrics for my wifey fo this Xmas

Need to sing better or I will be kicked out of house ahahaha


[dusk till dawn](https://open.spotify.com/track/4B4iRzb8er6Sq3EoPSp2lK?si=__JIgMArRM2lIoj3EjGQ_w)

I was yesterday years old when I found out about Wet Leg.

This is them performing Chaise Longue at Glastonbury (warning NSFW ish lyrics) https://youtu.be/iLX2WvGDbL0

This is them performing Ur Mum at Triple J (NSFW lyrics again) https://youtu.be/dMEhCZin6Mo
Any binaural beats channel that you guys can recommend?

Hi! Iâ€™m an independent pop-rock singer-songwriter based out of Bangalore and just put out my debut single, â€˜Ready To Breatheâ€™. Itâ€™s a song I wrote about feeling stuck in a rut and breaking free to feel alive. Would love you guys to hear it! [https://bfan.link/ready-to-breathe](https://bfan.link/ready-to-breathe)

I liked it, has a feel good vibe to it! Guitar solo and the acapella after that was great. Kudos 

I wonder how you managed to put so much in a song. Iâ€™d love to see you produce and sing in studio, just a suggestion for your next music video! :)
Thank you so much!! And cheers for the suggestion ðŸ§¡
